subsection_content:
Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is a disorder that involves chronic tissue inflammation in the digestive tract, including:
Ulcerative colitis: This is an inflammation and ulceration along the lining of the colon and rectum.; Ulcerative colitis: This is an inflammation and ulceration along the lining of the colon and rectum.
Crohn's disease: Crohn's disease is characterized by inflammation of the lining of the digestive tract, which can often involve deeper layers, most affecting the small intestine. Accordingly, the large intestine and upper digestive tract are also at risk of damage but are not common.; Crohn's disease: Crohn's disease is characterized by inflammation of the lining of the digestive tract, which can often involve deeper layers, most affecting the small intestine. Accordingly, the large intestine and upper digestive tract are also at risk of damage but are not common.
Characteristic signs of both forms are diarrhea, abdominal pain, fatigue, weight loss and rectal bleeding. Some cases only present with mild symptoms, but sometimes they are a warning of serious weakness, potentially leading to dangerous complications.
Crohn's disease is a typical form of intestinal inflammation
